overview:
Lani Fritts was most recently Vice President, Lockheed Martin Corporation, and Chief Executive Officer of Savi Performance Logistics, a wholly owned subsidiary of Lockheed Martin Corporation. Lani was responsible for domestic and international business development, sales, and government affairs for various business units within Savi Technology since joining the company in 2000, and since its subsequent acquisition by Lockheed Martin in 2006. Lani was instrumental in developing global technology and channel partnerships and alliances, developing business strategy, and launching Savi Networks, a joint venture between Lockheed Martin and Hutchison Port Holdings, a division of the Hutchison Whampoa Group based in Hong Kong, China. He served on the US Chamber of Commerce Infrastructure Security task force, the World Customs Organization task force on supply chain security, the ISO committee defining best practices in chain of custody control, and Lockheed Martinâ€™s corporate logistics business council.

Prior to Savi Technology, Lani held a variety of operating positions at Toys â€œRâ€ Us and was Director of Inventory Management, responsible for managing the flow of goods through 16 distribution centers to over 700 stores nationwide when he left in 1998.

Lani enjoys spending time with his wife Zara and their two girls, Keaton and Tatum. In his spare time, he has competed in several marathons and enjoys the occasional game of golf.

Lani has an MBA from Stanford University and a BA in economics from Georgetown University.
